page.title: 08Social Survey (Pets)
page.content:
Pupils at Sutton Benger School carried out a survey among 39 families with children at the school, covering many aspects of family life, housing, pets, transport and employment. The results yielded the following information:
{Pets} Many families have more than one pet, with the most popular animals being: Cat {44%;}Dog {38% Fish {28%;}Rabbit {26% Hamster, gerbil or guinea pig {15%;}Budgie {13% Fowls (ducks, hens etc) {10%;}Tortoise {8% Less usual pets included ponies -{5% and goats -{2%. {18%}of the sample did not have a pet.
